trans-unit.source: Specifies the default value for a property.
You can create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute> with any value.
A member's default value is typically its initial value.
A visual designer can use the default value to reset the member's value.
Code generators can use the default values also to determine whether code should be generated for the member.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute> will not cause a member to be automatically initialized with the attribute's value.
You must set the initial value in your code.
For more information, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that is the default value.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class, converting the specified value to the specified type, and using an invariant culture as the translation context.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type to convert the value to.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that can be converted to the type using the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> for the type and the U.S. English culture.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a single-precision floating point number.
A single-precision floating point number that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a 64-bit signed integer.
A 64-bit signed integer that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a 32-bit signed integer.
A 32-bit signed integer that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a 16-bit signed integer.
A 16-bit signed integer that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a double-precision floating point number.
A double-precision floating point number that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using a Unicode character.
A Unicode character that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class using an 8-bit unsigned integer.
An 8-bit unsigned integer that is the default value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref> class.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the default value.
Returns whether the value of the given object is equal to the current <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute"></xref>.
The object to test the value equality of.
`true` if the value of the given object is equal to that of the current; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Sets the default value for the property to which this attribute is bound.
The default value.
Gets the default value of the property this attribute is bound to.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the default value of the property this attribute is bound to.
